Wyrom
Monday, August 7th, 2017, 10:02:35 PM

Starting today, I will be moving my communication effort to these forums as a continued goal to keep several channels open to our player base. The official forums will still be a launching point for all GemStone IV announcements as well as official communication, but as time goes on, we will utilize these forums more and more. Thank you to everyone who made it possible.

Wyrom
Monday, August 7th, 2017, 10:46:40 PM

Someone pointed something out to me that I want to make sure is clear. The officials (forums.play.net) are still the main communication outlet for GemStone IV. I'm moving away from the Players' Corner. We tried it out, but I need a little more structure. These forums offer that.

There are a few places I'd like to support where myself and other GameMasters can communication with our players. Here. The GemStone IV Slack channel. And some Discord servers. It will be slow, but updating how we communicate will only benefit the game. Improving our staff culture is important.

viekn

What's the overall difference between slack and discord?

Maylan
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 12:21:08 PM

@viekn said in Forum Communication:

What's the overall difference between slack and discord?

Personal preference - Discord offers voice chat and is geared towards gamers. Slack is a "workplace productivity tool" (lol) that I can get away with using at the office. Both are miles better than AIM. I recommend tinkering with each of them and seeing which one you like better. Or, just get sucked into both like some of us have.
